availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Frankfort, Kentucky, trader. Virginia native. Son of Lucy B. Cunningham. Married to Mary Katherine. Vaughan Cunningham in Shelby County, Kentucky, on July 30, 1861. Father of Elvy Cunningham. Trader in Frankfort in 1860. Merchant in Franklin County in 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort, District 2, p. 68A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort, District 2, p. 314.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort, Bridgeport Precinct, p. 54B.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Roll #994054, Shelby County Marriages, p. 15 of microfilm.
Vital Statistics Original Death Certificates – Microfilm (1911-1964), KDLA, Roll #Film 7020620: All Counties, p. 1503 of microfilm, Shelby County File# 17998.
